habitat_description:
The main range of this species is found in Mexico, in the states of Coahuila, Durango, Nuevo Leon, San Luis Potosi, Zacatecas, and Tamaulipas. Records indicate the establishment of this species in southern Texas (Cole and Hardy 1981; 1983; Natureserve.org).  This species is known to burrow in or using soil, leaf litter, and decaying logs.

Habitats of preference include grassland, thorn brush associations, shrubland, chaparral, desert, savanna, hardwood woodland, desert flats, and wooded mountain canyons (Conant and Collins 1991; Tennant 1998).
